summary: SDK version was being read redundantly from package.json instead of using the already-loaded pkg module. The issue was that package.json was being accessed multiple times when the pkg module should have been reused for efficiency.
userImpact: No direct user impact; this is an internal code quality issue where redundant file access could cause minor performance inefficiency.
rootCause: package.json was being read directly in conversions.rs instead of reusing the already-loaded pkg module, causing redundant file access.
proposedFix: Use the pkg module instead of reading package.json again to eliminate the redundant file access.
resolutionDetails: Resolved by removing the redundant package.json access and using the pkg module instead, implemented in PR #288.
keyQuote: I'd still change to use the `pkg` module instead of reading package.json again.
